exercises.name: Leg Swings (Front/Back & Lateral)
exercises.note: Dynamic stretch for hip flexors and hamstrings. Keep torso upright and swing smooth. Preps the hips for lateral work and mounting.

exercises.name: Hip Circles (Standing Hip CARs)
exercises.note: Imagine drawing a circle with your knee. Warms up the joint and identifies tight spots before you get in the saddle.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges with Twist
exercises.note: Twist toward the front leg. Stretches the hip flexor and warms up glutes/quads for better stability in the two-point.

exercises.name: Lateral Lunge Stretch
exercises.note: Sit back into the hip. Opens the groin to help you sit deep and move your legs independently of your seat.

exercises.name: Open & Close the Gate
exercises.note: Mimics the motion of mounting. Preps the thigh to move away from and back to the saddle with control.

exercises.name: Arm Circles & Trunk Rotations
exercises.note: Loosen shoulders for clearer rein aids. A mobile upper back allows you to follow the horse's motion better.

exercises.name: ON-HORSE: Thigh Lifts
exercises.note: At the walk: Lift thighs off the saddle. This serves as a reminder to balance on your seat bones rather than gripping.

exercises.name: ON-HORSE: Pelvic Clocks
exercises.note: Tilt hips to find mobility in the seat. Improves your ability to absorb the horse's rhythm through your core.

exercises.name: ON-HORSE: Posting/Two-Point Transitions
exercises.note: Transitions at the trot. Builds leg endurance and helps you maintain balance over jumps.

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Stretch (Kneeling)
exercises.note: Tuck tailbone and shift forward. Prevents that 'locked hip' feeling after a long day of riding.

exercises.name: Figure-4 Glute Stretch
exercises.note: Targets deep hip rotators that get tight from the sitting trot. Keep the foot flexed to protect your knee.

exercises.name: Chest & Shoulder Opener
exercises.note: Counteracts rounding during riding. Improves your posture and makes your rein contact more consistent.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.note: CUE: Weight in heels, knees out. Develops leg strength for a secure two-point and landing jumps.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
exercises.note: CUE: Hinge from hips. Strengthens glutes and back to keep you from tipping forward if the horse pulls.

exercises.name: Copenhagen Plank (Bent Knee)
exercises.note: CUE: Squeeze inner thighs. Drastically improves groin resilience for a snug contact without 'gripping'.

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat
exercises.note: Stronger quads allow you to maintain an upright posture even when the horse's motion is powerful.

exercises.name: Single-Leg RDL
exercises.note: Challenges ankle and hip stability—similar to balancing in stirrups independently.

exercises.name: Box Jumps
exercises.note: CUE: Soft landing. Trains fast-twitch fibers for quick balance adjustments after a fence.

exercises.name: Split Squat Jumps
exercises.note: Explosive intent. Develops the coordination to quickly stabilize your position after dynamic movements.

exercises.name: Turkish Get-Up
exercises.note: Integrates core, shoulder, and hip stability. Teaches you to move smoothly while staying braced.

exercises.name: Stirrup Stand (BOSU Plank)
exercises.note: Forces core and ankles to stabilize in an unstable stance, mimicking the stirrup experience.
